strings:
<se_low>King Trode: Oh, my poor minister!
The curse has deformed you, too...
<se_low>King Trode: ...Although, it was unleashed in the middle of the night... So what were you doing in the courtroom? On my throne!?
<se_low>King Trode: So! You enjoy the feeling of being enthroned, do you!? Well your secret is out now, you frivolous old fool!

<se_low>King Trode: Ah, my head chef.
There's nothing quite like your scrambled eggs!
But when will I taste them again?

<se_low>King Trode: This was Medea's attendant.
Oh, what a sorry state to be in!
<se_low>King Trode: Medea used to play the piano exquisitely, but I don't suppose her hooves are as nimble as her fingers were.
<se_low>King Trode: Even her beautifully warbling voice has turned into a beautifully whinnying voice...

<se_low>King Trode: What a wretched situation!
But I swear I shall see you turned back
to your former self, my precious child!
<se_low>King Trode: It was this magic circle that saved Medea and I from the thorns.
<se_low>King Trode: Yes, in the end, the magic circle my ancestors drew to protect the world from the power of the sceptre helped only to protect their descendants from it.
<se_low>King Trode: We must be grateful to them. ...Although I would be more grateful if they had also protected us from these vexing transformations!
<se_low>King Trode: The library is behind this door, but it's quite impossible to get through like this.

<se_low>King Trode: But there is another way into the
library from within the castle.
We shall have to use that entrance.
